title: Software Developer

text:
Job description
Always had a passion for building things? Looking for a thrilling challenge in a fast-growing environment? Then we have the right challenge for you!
We are seeking an experienced IT professional to help us support our membership program and develop our data project. You will work on different projects that will have a direct effect on how G2 engages and rewards its users. If you have experience developing mobile applications, data projects and web based applications you are the person we are looking for. 
The role will be located in our HQ in Berlin, Germany and the ideal start date is as early as possible.
 Responsibilities
Help develop multiple projects in our pipeline
Enlarge and expand the current G2 data project
Help manage relationships with external agencies
Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects
Research relevant industry experts, competitors, target audience and users
Brainstorm new, creative approaches to our IT solutions 
 Requirements
Must have
Education: BS / BA in IT
Experience: 3+ years of experience in developing websites, applications and data projects 
Proven track record of successful projects meaning you have applications, websites and data projects you developed alone or in a team and can present to us
In-depth knowledge of the following tools and platforms:
Modern Web Frameworks
Hybrid (React Native) or native app development (both IOS and Android)
BI-Tools and data storage knowledge
In-depth knowledge of the following languages and frameworks:
HTML5 / CSS / JavaScript
SQL
Highly structured and can work well both autonomously and in a team environment

Good to have
Experienced working with analytics tools (Salesforce, Netbase, Socialbakers, GA)
Experience with the following languages and frameworks:
Python
Experience with the following tools and platforms:
Shopify
AWS
DevOps experience
Ability to start as soon as possible
E-commerce experience
Avid gamer

What is like working at G2 Esports?

Work Culture. You will be surrounded by experienced, successful and ambitious co-workers that will push you to your limits in a positive and inspiring working atmosphere. A workplace where unity, honesty, pioneering, fairness and integrity are valued.

Perks. Competitive salary; office in the heart of Berlin; gym membership; great IT equipment; flexible working times; additional holidays & being a part of the G2 family.

Development. Get mentored by some of the best within esport and access a wide network of great people and companies inside and outside of the industry.
title: Full Stack Software Developer

text:
Before applying, see https://youtu.be/J7-gIa6jiP0.

The Laurel provides the infrastructure for any volunteering project that wants to reward its volunteers with global, immutable, provable proofs of merit.

We use blockchain technology and other web3 tools to ensure immutability and protocol decentralization. The Laurel protocol tackles continuous voting, proof creation, new mechanisms of game theory focused on incentivizing generosity, distributed computing issues.

The Laurel is built by volunteers, awarded with generosity and meta-generosity points - laurels and medals.

If you join The Laurel's team of volunteers, your generosity will be part of the next moral revolution.

If you are a software engineer, your challenges will be:
blockchain technology, especially Ethereum: ethers.js, Solidity, Yul, EVM assembly - we are building our own EVM interpreted functional language (for both on and off-chain)
JavaScript, Node.js, React.js
React Native - we are building a programable chat application and wallet, using web3 technologies
Rust, WebAssembly

Please be punctual.
We appreciate people who do not shy away from necessary conflict.
title: Volunteer Software Engineer

text:
About Datadog:

We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.

The Team:

The Adversary Simulation Engineering team helps keep Datadog safe by developing tools and frameworks to automate discovery of infrastructure exposure, identify vulnerabilities, and simulate real life attacks within the organization.

The Opportunity:

As a software engineer for the Adversary Simulation Engineering team, you will design, build and integrate tools for various attack phases (reconnaissance, infiltration, persistence), and deploy them on immutable infrastructure. You will collaborate with other security teams to understand the evolving security evasion needs and implement them in offensive tools and systems.

We're looking for engineers experienced in modern infrastructure tech, cloud environments, and distributed systems with an adversarial security mindset.

You Will:
Design, develop, and maintain automated infrastructure, systems and services that improve offensive security capabilities
Prototype new ideas, test new open-source offensive security tools and improve existing ones
Work across the stack to deliver new adversarial features from start-to-finish
Research and monitor emerging trends and techniques in offensive tooling

You Are:
You have demonstrated significant experience in full stack software development
You are fluent in one or more programming experience (Golang, Python, JavaScript etc)
You have architected, built, and operated systems to solve problems at scale
Experience with immutable infrastructure deployments and cloud automation technologies, such as Terraform
High level understanding of the security principles of at least one AWS, GCP, Azure
You are able to work both independently and collaboratively
You want to work in a fast, high growth environment

Bonus Points:
You have developed offensive tooling
You have knowledge of offensive security concepts
You've lead complex projects with a team of engineers
OCSP, CEH or similar pentesting certifications

This is a remote position

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.
title: Software Engineer - Adversary Simulation Engineering

text:
EVOCAL Health is a digital diagnostics company with the mission of unlocking the human voice as a prognostic and diagnostic biomarker. Using innovative technology, we develop clinically-proven digital diagnostic and therapeutic concepts using Vocal Biomarkers and Artificial Intelligence to create interventions to prevent, predict and manage health.

Our first product will be one of the first digital health applications that are approved as a medical device and help patients with (chronic) diseases through a multi-modal and guideline based digital therapy concept. Our mobile app gives users access to a diagnostic and therapeutic solution, that digitizes the "gold standard" of therapies. The app is based on our AI powered algorithm, that diagnoses health using the human voice and a smartphone. In the near future, we will release digital therapies in the fields of respiratory, cardiovascular and neurodegenerative diseases.

Our team combines expertise in artificial intelligence, machine learning, product management, medicine, engineering and computer science to envision and design the next generation of healthcare tools and services. We partner with leading research facilities, life sciences organizations, healthcare providers and governmental organizations to enable fast development, meaningful stakeholder integrations and development at scale.

Today we have been voted one of the fastest growing startups in Germany and are an innovation leader in the field of digital therapeutics. We are founded by experienced healthcare professionals, have raised initial capital from investors and are currently building an exceptional team based in Hamburg and Göttingen (Germany): A team to join our mission to unlock the human voice as a biomarker for health and make longevity accessible.

Tasks

As a Software Engineer at EVOCAL Health, you will help develop, build and iterate the product within an interdisciplinary and emerging team across all of EVOCAL’s departments to support planning, development and execution.

You will use your software engineering expertise to develop software that helps patients understand their disease and manage their health, as well as further develop our digital therapeutics platform based on a patient-centric product vision.
Actively participate in product development and iteration within a cross-functional, self-managed team by participating in concept work and implementation for the back and frontend of our application
Contribute to the development of the digital therapeutics platform based on Ruby on Rails, including architectural decisions based on a patient-centric product vision
Requirements
Deep technical knowledge of backend development using Ruby on Rails with software architecture & data modelling skills, and the ability to make software engineering decisions on product vision
Willingness and ability to work in a cross-functional, product-focused team, and the ability to actively participate in the conceptualization in the health and medical context
Communication skills in English
Additional Qualifications
Experience in software development in the medical device environment and experience with quality-driven software development and its regulatory framework
Benefits
The opportunity to have a positive impact on solving one of our world’s biggest challenges: Enabling humans and patients to live a longer and healthier life and thereby contributing to one of the UNs most impactful SDGs
Providing patients with remote access to gold standard therapies, managing chronic conditions and play a vital role in the design of a new kind of digital health applications based on scientific insights and real-world evidence
Attractive salary with 30 days holiday per year, flexible working hours, home office policy, and a working environment, that is oriented on work outcomes
Personal training and development in a motivated, interdisciplinary team in a fast-growing digital health startup environment
A working environment, that values diversity and empowers everyone to be their authentic self as a key ingredient for personal development and company success
We are looking forward to your application and hope to get to know you personally.
title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER (m/f/d) at EVOCAL Health

text:
Product And Responsibilities

OpSpace is a Barco product easing the daily work of a control room operator. It is a distributed system based on Linux which provides freely configurable workplaces integrating all kind of application and video sources along with a highly efficient UI allowing fast interaction in mission critical environment. Each workplace can be composed of multiple hardware clients and has multiple server-backends. Integrated into a highly efficient UI OpSpace offers various application and video sources, which can be customized, shared between users and used concurrently in the same workplace. To further increase functionality of OpSpace, Barco is looking for a Software Developer Backend (m/w/d).

Your responsibility is to design, implement and maintain OpSpace backend using latest technologies. Since the result of your work is part of a bigger system, you need to align and integrate with work result of other teams.

Function

You will be part of an agile R&D team working in a modern environment on the development of software products for video wall applications and operator workplaces used in critical infrastructure. Your team will be based in Karlsruhe/Germany, with close relations to Barco headquarter in Belgium and our development site in India.

Your daily work will be in an agile scrum team developing simple and timely solutions to complex problems to maintain Barco's market leadership in video wall solutions. You will be part of an agile software organization that focuses on ownership and team responsibility instead of hiding behind cumbersome processes.

Qualifications
Master degree or equivalent in a relevant technical discipline
Able to work in a multicultural environment
Fluent in English
Good communications skills
Good knowledge of Python and GIT
Interest in backend development
Preferably some experience with Java and JavaScript
Preferably some experience with Jenkins and Test Driven Design
Preferably some administrational knowledge in Linux and MongoDB
Our Offer
A permanent contract with a fair salary
Working with modern tools in an agile software development process
Collaboration on high-quality products for the industrial environment
An interesting and challenging job in a flexible working environment
Membership of a highly motivated, interdisciplinary and international team
Internal training in our Barco University
title: Software Developer Backend (m/f/d)

text:
Snke OS™ is a universally deployable digital B2B platform, founded in 2020 & headquartered in Munich. Emerging technologies continue to drive a digital transformation in the healthcare economy. Our founders recognized the potential for value creation by decoupling & deploying their best-in-class platform & team so that other companies can scale up & innovate efficiently. Fueled by AI & big data analytics, Snke OS delivers the platform & infrastructure that enables partners across the healthcare industry to deploy digital solutions for safer & more efficient interventions.

The 150-person Snke OS team brings a wealth of experience to the new company with backgrounds in large platforms, digital health & software-driven medical technology. Let’s impact the industry together! We are looking for pioneers to lead fast & lead first with Snke OS.

Software Engineer – Data Management

What To Expect

As Software Engineer you will be part of our Data Management team. Together with your team mates you will create and maintain a data management framework that builds the foundation of all our applications.

The data management framework contains components and services which read, write, convert and process medical information. One side of the interface is typically represented by standard medical data formats like DICOM, HL7 and FHIR . The other side of the interface are either applications directly building on top of the data management framework, or services and micro-services providing, among others, gRPC APIs or web based interfaces like REST APIs to build a mesh of capabilities representing the core of our new SnkeOS Heathcare Platform which is being utilized by several new medical applications. This of course includes additional aspects like cyber security considerations, data persistence, interprocess-communication and concurrent programming as well.

Expect to be challenged on a daily basis by your colleagues – experts on medical data, technical enthusiasts with a broad skill set, product owners and project engineers with a lot of knowledge on building highly innovative medical products. We work together, with an open mindset, always striving for the best possible solution.

When joining this position, you will
Develop software in an agile environment
Build the next generation of the SnkeOS Heathcare Platform for the global market
Be able to bring in your view and your expertice by actively contribute to the team especially on technical concepts
Learn a lot about data management with focus on the medical products
Make a positive impact by contributing to the healthcare system for the benfit of patients
Have fun working with great people
What You Offer
A degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent working experience
Good experience in developing software with C++
Knowledge in other programming languages like C#, JavaScript, Python is preferred
Ideally experience with REST and/or gRPC
Knowledge and/or interest in medical data standards such as DICOM, HL7 or FHIR
Interested in state of the art web technologies like HTTP, REST, JSON or services and micro-services.
Analytical mindset and creativity to develop extraordinary solutions
Very good communication skills in English; German is a strong plus
What We Offer
Centrally located, modern work spaces
30 days of vacation plus 24.12. and 31.12.
Home office and flexible working hours
Free gym courses with showers and changing rooms
Secure bicycle storage room
Restaurant, coffee shop on-site
Regular after-work, team & company events
Great 212m² roof terrace
International team of supportive colleagues
Comprehensive training and continuing education opportunities
Interested? Then we are looking forward to receiving your online application!

Contact person: Daniel Sypli
title: Software Engineer - Data Management

text:
Software Architect (f/m/d) in Python with Developer background
Your tasks: 
You are a self-motivated python developer and want to join our agile team? You are constantly striving for improvement and eager to implement innovations in a regulated banking environment? Welcome and help us to build and improve our risk platform. You will be part of a team that works in close collaboration with business departments to understand their needs and develop efficient software solutions for them. Pattern and approaches like 12 factor app, domain driven design and clean code comes natural to you? As one of our Python experts you will lead the planning, designing, and development our new target technologic Platform. After all, we value the exchange of ideas, being there for each other and encouraging each other to become better. We call it: the exchange mindset. 
 You bring along:
Several years of working experience in development and design of backend solutions 
Experience with scalable applications and the concepts of containerized, service-oriented, microservices architectures
Solid knowledge in Python 3.7 or higher
Broad knowledge of opensource products (like Flask or Django)
Focus on detail and passion to use and write maintainable and high-quality software
Team player and show initiative & ownership in a dynamic, agile environment
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal in German and English
 We offer you:
Attractive salary package with many benefits including childcare facilities, meal allowance, job ticket, sport and recreational events
Personal development thanks to extensive further training opportunities
A place in a dynamic and international team within EEX Group and Deutsche Börse Group
A long-term perspective in the constantly growing and evolving energy industry
Bespoke onboarding plan
title: Python Developer

text:
Are you a great developer who wants to get real hacking skills? We offer you the place to become an expert!

Job Description
We are looking for an ambitious and enthusiastic software developer who would like to further develop his or her skills. You will practice with us and learn how to become an expert on digital identities, trust and security. You will learn how to create architectures that are inherently secure. Doing so, you will become an expert on secure programming. You will contribute to our own SaaS applications with which we reach millions of end users. Our code is mission critical for many of our high-profile customers.

Responsibilities
The primary responsibilities will include:
Write software that matters! Be part of the team that will enable online authentication for millions of users.
Get training and guidance to become an expert at writing secure software
Penetration test our own software, share secure programming knowledge
Analyze functional requirements and turn them into real software.
Assist in designing and improving our software architecture
Build and maintain a catalogue of reusable, elegant solution patterns;
Build and maintain a library of reusable, elegant software components;
Improve standards and guidelines for using these patterns and components.
We work agile, so take part in daily stand-ups and discuss safety features with the product owner

Requirements
At least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science
5+ years of experience developing Java/Kotlin web applications
Fluent in German and English
Programming is not just your work, it is your hobby and your passion
You enjoy explaining things, discussions and knowledge sharing
You are a self-starter able to work from high level ideas and concepts
Experience with Javascript and related tooling, Java 8 and/or Kotlin
Experience using CI/CD, version control, and unit testing
Experience with self-sovereign identity protocols, W3C, hyperledger · Familiarity with any of the following technologies and methodologies: Spring Boot, OIDC, Angular, Linux, SCRUM/Kanban, REST, Gitlab, PostgreSQL, QA, SAML

What we offer
Working at Signicat means committing to an organization with a welcoming atmosphere, with fun and intellectually stimulating colleagues. We communicate informally and know how to find each other easily. We are open to feedback and are very critical. We work hard and with great pleasure.
Competitive salary
25 vacation days
Pension scheme, and bonus
Fast-growing technical organization with a flat organizational structure
Plenty of room for personal development
You will be well taken care of with drinks, fruit, fresh salads and a lunch without a cash register.

About Signicat
Signicat is a Digital Identity Service Provider (DISP) and is one of the leading providers of electronic identity and signature solutions in Europe/globally. Our security solutions are used at all levels from government and big banks to small business—and everywhere in between. We continue to be leaders in innovative security solutions, reducing risk while providing a smart and intuitive user experience. Signicat has earned the trust of institutions and businesses by providing user authentication, electronic signing, identity proofing and document preservation.
We are a fast-growing company that has a track record of success as one of the most complete providers of electronic identification services for the Nordic and European markets. While enjoying continued growth we have kept the best of our ‘startup’ ethos, encouraging creativity, initiative and independence to get things done. We value the well-being of each employee and all work together to create a supportive and inspiring work environment.
Signicat has almost 250 employees at offices in Trondheim (headquarters), Oslo, Bergen, Copenhagen, Helsinki, Stockholm, Rotterdam, Munich, Lisbon and Bucharest. Our focus is security and professionalism and we are constantly working to improve our product and ourselves.
Please use the application-link, upload your CV and write some words about why you may be interested in working with us. If you want to be part of our highly talented, professional and creative team, then we want to hear from you!
No recruitment companies please.
title: Java/Kotlin software developer

text:
Aufgaben
Du brennst für die objektorientierte Programmierung, hast Spaß daran, dein Wissen und deine Erfahrung in der agilen Softwareentwicklung einzubringen und kannst dich für die neuesten Technologien und Trends in der IT begeistern.
Nutze dein Know-How in der Softwareentwicklung und bringe es in einem agilen Umfeld ein
Im Rahmen deiner Aufgaben setzt du den Fokus auf die innovative Neu- und Weiterentwicklung unserer Produktkomponenten
Die hochwertige Qualität unserer Softwarelösungen sicherst du durch regelmäßiges Testen
Du gestaltest den Softwareentwicklungsprozess und unsere internen Prozesse aktiv mit und arbeitest an hochinteressanten und fachlich anspruchsvollen Projekten

Benefits
Wir bieten dir ein attraktives Gehalt und bezuschussen deine monatliche Sporteinheit
Regelmäßige und systematische (externe und interne) Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Modernes Arbeiten in einem innovativen und internationalen Team

Qualifikationen
Nach deinem erfolgreich abgeschlossenem Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder einem ähnlichen Studienfach möchtest du voll durchstarten
Du konntest bereits erste praktische Erfahrungen in der Programmierung sammeln und hast gute Kenntnisse in zumindest einer objektorientierten Sprache (z.B. Java)
Idealerweise hast du auch Kenntnisse in C++, Webentwicklung (HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, GUI-Frameworks)
Eine selbständige und zielgerichtete Arbeitsweise, Kommunikationsstärke und Teamfähigkeit zeichnen dich aus
Du bist bereit, national zu reisen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Macros Reply: Digitalisierung & Automatisierung
Macros Reply ist Experte in der Digitalisierung und Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen für Versicherungen und Finanzdienstleister. Um deren hohen Anspruch gerecht zu werden, entwickelt Macros Reply für die Kernfunktionalitäten eigene, flexibel konfigurierbare Software und ergänzt diese mit Lösungen von ausgewählten, geprüften und langjährigen Partnern. Mittels innovativen Technologien wie Process Mining, Robotic Process Automation (RPA) und Machine Learning hilft Macros seinen Kunden sich in moderne, schnell agierende Unternehmen zu verwandeln: Die Sachbearbeitung wird von Routine-Arbeiten entlastet und bei wertschöpfenden Tätigkeiten unterstützt, ebenso profitiert der Kunde von deutlich verkürzten Bearbeitungszeiten. Macros Reply steht auch für: ECM, Vorgangsbearbeitung & DMS, Verteilregelwerke, Workflows & Prozessmanagement, elektronische Akten & Postkörbe, sowie Archivierung.
title: Junior Softwareentwickler (m/w/d)

text:
The Elgato Stream Deck is the premier control device for the majority of the world’s most popular streamers and online content creators. We are looking for a Junior Software Engineer to join our Stream Deck core development team. In this position you will use your creativity, ingenuity, and full skill set to contribute directly to the industry leading software that powers Stream Deck and the SDK used by our 3rd party plugin developers. 

What you will be working on 
Your main objective is the development of cross-platform macOS and Windows desktop applications in C++ 
WeYou will use the Qt framework to abstract platform dependent functions such as the UI 
You can work throughout the entire software stack from hardware support to user interface 
You can work on the core application, the integrated web host, and the fusion of them both 
You may make improvements to the Stream Deck SDK to empower future plugins 
Integrate new Stream Deck devices into our ecosystem 
Contribute to products that are highly loved by our customers and share in their delight at your work 

What we are looking for 
University degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent education or professional experience 
Confident skills in C++; Python 3.x and Javascript experience is beneficial 
Strong drive to write clean code based around architectural magnificence 
Experience with programming Qt Widgets is beneficial 
Interest in Elgato products, being a user If you are aof Stream Deck is a plus user then this is very interesting 
Experience developing software on macOS or Windows is beneficial 
Fluency in both written and spoken English; German skills are an advantage.

About Us
Elgato is the brand of choice for video production technology among content creators on all platforms. If you’ve watched live gaming or any streaming content on YouTube or Twitch, chances are we helped make it shine.
Our mission is to empower content creators everywhere. Be part of the team that makes this happen.
In 2018, Elgato was acquired by Corsair, a provider of high-performance PCs and peripherals. Over the last three decades Corsair has cemented its leadership position in its key markets and continues to grow rapidly. As a semi-autonomous division of Corsair, Elgato has engineering offices in Munich and Mönchengladbach in Germany, and in California, and we distribute our products in over eighty countries around the globe.
Elgato’s award winning product range combines cutting edge technologies with industry leading industrial design and user experiences to deliver an unparalleled level of performance to customers. Our focus is always on simplicity and enabling the best possible workflow for content creators.

What we offer you
Flexible working hours and a friendly, positive working environment
A focus on personal development and training in any relevant discipline
Modern and comfortable offices in the center of Munich and Mönchengladbach
Discounts on Elgato, Corsair, Origin, and Scuf Gaming products
Great coffee on tap, drinks, fruit, catered team lunch on Fridays and discounted lunch vouchers on other days.
title: Junior Software Engineer - Stream Deck (m/f/d)

text:
Flutter. Software engineering.

New Venture, focusing on solving one of the biggest problems of the German/ European healthcare system. Work with a small world class team, enjoy modern and smart work environment, a 4 day work-week, a motivated and young team, 100% remote working option.
title: Softwareingenieur

text:
There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.

We’re looking for experienced Software Engineers to join our growing team working on delivering expanding Snowflakes’s Geospatial analysis capabilities in Berlin, Germany. The team is responsible for extending spatial features and enhancing query optimization and query execution techniques to further enhance performance. This role offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact to Snowflake in a rapidly growing area for location-aware analytic applications.

AS A GEOSPATIAL QUERY PROCESSING ENGINEER AT SNOWFLAKE YOU WILL:
Design, develop and extend Snowflake’s geospatial data processing engine using novel and sophisticated new algorithms
Analyze and understand performance and scalability bottlenecks in the system and drive resolution of them.
Support our customers by pinpointing problems, instrumenting relevant components as needed, and ultimately implementing solutions to the issues identified.
Deal with issues from logical representation of the execution plan to efficient resource management, all the way down to highly specialized vectorized execution.
Evaluate and determine priorities with a critical understanding of where performance matters while retaining ease-of-use and system reliability
Our Ideal Geospatial Query Processing Engineer Will Have
2+ years hands-on software engineering experience.
Experience with Geospatial Information Systems and geospatial libraries as well as solutions of common geospatial problems.
Background in database internals or building core components for large scale data processing systems (i.e. Hadoop, Spark), especially query execution/processing, and/or optimization.
Strong CS fundamentals including data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems.
Systems programming skills including multi-threading, concurrency, etc.
Fluency in C++ or C, and Java
Extremely strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Excellent interpersonal communication skills
Outstanding written and oral English language skills
BS in Computer Science; Masters or PhD Preferred.
Bonus Points For The Following
Strong database fundamentals including SQL, performance, multi-threading, and schema design.
Experience using big data storage technologies and their applications (HDFS, Cassandra, Columnar Databases, etc.)
German language skills
Experience reading and integrating data from multiple sources.
WHY JOIN THE QUERY PROCESSING TEAM AT SNOWFLAKE?

As a Member Of Our Team, You Will

Why join the engineering team at Snowflake. Building new enterprise technologies is complex, and our engineering team surmounts the obstacles.
Build an industry-leading data management system that customers love.
Solve challenging technical problems related to security, parallel and distributed systems, programming, resource management, large-scale system maintenance, and more!
Learn about and contribute to:
Super-robust and secure enterprise SaaS platform that services hundreds of customers and millions of complex queries daily.
Highly-scalable and reliable data processing platform that runs on hundreds and thousands of machines.
Join a world-class team of both industry veterans and rising stars.
Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

How do you want to make your impact?

text:
Junior Software Engineer (m/f/d) Quoting & Pricing Sea Logistics | Germany | req79957

Join our self-responsible and fast-moving agile development team (KANBAN), with focus on the development of high-quality mission-critical products for the global Sea Logistics.



YOUR ROLE

Reliable, high-performance and customer-oriented solutions are the pioneers of our first-class logistics services. Our IT team in Hamburg is a large and important part our success. In this area, specialists ensure our smooth IT operations day after day - and here we develop IT systems in interdisciplinary projects, using modern methods, with which we extend our lead in terms of speed, reliability and customer orientation. Worldwide, as a team, hand in hand with the departments and soon with you.



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

Be involved throughout the entire development lifecycle, from requirements definition through realization to demo and product delivery.
Work closely with the business department to find the best technical and functional solution for new feature requests.
Transform business user´s requirements into technical specifications.
Develop, test and maintain applications from global Quoting & Pricing Portfolio (Web/Desktop).
Identify and propose changes to improve Development Process.
Solve defects reported from Test and Production Environments.


YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES

Professional experience in building scalable and reliable IT products (ideally in an agile team).
College degree in technical engineering or equivalent.
Solid understanding of object-oriented programming, design and architectural patterns.
Hands-on experience with actual Java-Enterprise technologies, like Spring, JPA/Hibernate, Junit and SQL technologies.
First experience with front-end technologies, like Angular, HTML5, or CSS3.
Experience developing RESTful Web Services, and with environments and tools, like IntelliJ, Git, Maven, Docker and Jenkins.
Proactive attitude and open mindset
Proficient in spoken and written English, German is a plus but not mandatory.


GOOD REASON TO JOIN

We want you to feel comfortable in your working surroundings. Therefore, we are offering you modern offices in the announced Hamburg Hafencity directly adjacent to the Elbe, flexible working hours, mobile working arrangement, a subsidized job ticket for the public transportation as well as a canteen with a broad range of menus. Kühne + Nagel is offering you a custom-made career - through individual planning and supervisors who support and advice you in every way. Personally, you get supported by a lot of work-life-balance offerings, a company pension and a supplementary health insurance.



ABOUT KUEHNE + NAGEL

With over 74000 employees at some 1,300 locations in over 100 countries, the Kuehne + Nagel Group is one of the world's leading logistics companies.

Kühne + Nagel is an employer that offers equal opportunities and values disabled employees to benefit from the diversity in our teams. We believe that you can be a valuable asset for Kühne + Nagel and therefore we are looking forward to your application.



CONTACT

Theo Zimmermann
+49 160 4497391
title: Junior Software Engineer (m/f/d) Sea Logistics

text:
LivePerson is a transformational force in how brands and consumers communicate. With over 18,000 brands, including HSBC, Verizon, and Home Depot, we are on a mission to make life easier for people and brands everywhere through trusted Conversational AI. We believe in a future where conversations are the norm for getting your intentions fulfilled - whatever they are.

We are an innovative, intent-driven company that believes in building the future and we are looking for growth minded, unconventional thinkers, developers and builders to join the team.

You Will Thrive Here If
You can operate in a fast paced, dynamic environment
You can build partnerships that move our business forward
You build code that is simple, understandable, and clean
You see feedback or failure as motivation to learn and to grow
You believe data-driven decision making is the norm
You relate to our core principles (link) and want to work with Conversational AI experts
In This Role You Will
Use your expert knowledge to design and implement robust highly-available back-end services that scale
Be responsible and drive the adoption of new and exciting technologies.
Assess the impact of new features based on metrics that are visualized on our dashboards
Support other team members and work together with colleagues around the world to achieve the best results
Your Qualifications Are
Good TypeScript or JavaScript coding skills
Interest in learning about large-scale distributed systems.
Experience in working with RESTful/Webhook APIs,
Interest in learning about APIs such as Facebook or Twilio is plus
Experience with CI, configuration management and containerization solutions.
Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
Ability to solve complex development problems and produce the highest quality code while striving to push the technical boundaries of SaaS applications
Ability to work quickly while maintaining strong attention to detail and accuracy
Strong communication and organizational skills
Why You’ll Love Working Here

LivePerson was named to FastCompany’s World’s most innovative companies of 2020 list for the Artificial Intelligence category. We offer top tier tech & data science colleagues, along with opportunities to push your own limits. We embrace invention and experimentation. Most importantly, you’ll have an ability to make an impact at work and at brands across the globe as we build the future with trusted Conversational AI together.

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to do their best work and be their authentic selves. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
title: Software Development Engineer

text:
OCELL‘s software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of hectares of forestry are managed by introducing data-based decision making to improve health and carbon storage capacity. Our products need to handle information at massive scale and extend well beyond classical geodata applications. We are looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system

design, networking and data storage, artificial intelligence, UI design and mobile. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to OCELL’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full stack as we continue to push technology forward. We believe that, in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services. We hire people who are smart and passionate, and we favor ability and willingness to learn over experience. We are hiring full time positions as well as part time positions for students that are currently enrolled in a master’s degree.

Aufgaben

Responsibilities
Utilize your expertise to engage in and enhance the development of our product’s software components in all fields of software engineering
Collaborate on scalability issues involving large scale data and processing
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software
Qualifikation

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor‘s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
Experience in coding Python, Dart or JavaScript
Ability to speak and write in English fluently
Ability to work in a small and agile team with quick decision making
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Flutter
Experience with additional general purpose programming languages, such as: Kotlin, Swift, Typescript
Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design
Experience with AWS and containerized processing workflows
Experience with Git, software testing and release processes
Benefits

Benefits
We want our employees to benefit from the success of this company and thus involve you not only with salary but also with virtual shares
Central location, with great startup vibes
Once the pandemic allows it, we’re going back to regular team activities outdoors
Have a large influence in the development of a meaningful solution to an urgent topic for humanity
Our Corporate Culture

OCELL is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender.
title: Software Developer (f/m/x) at Ocell GmbH

text:
LivePerson is a transformational force in how brands and consumers communicate. With over 18,000 brands, including HSBC, Disney, Verizon, and Home Depot, we are on a mission to make life easier for people and brands everywhere through trusted Conversational AI. We believe in a future where conversations are the norm for getting your intentions fulfilled - whatever they are.

We are an innovative, intent-driven company that believes in building the future and we are looking for growth minded, unconventional thinkers, developers and builders to join the team.

You Will Thrive Here If
You can operate in a fast paced, dynamic environment
You can build partnerships that move our business forward
You build code that is simple, understandable, and clean
You see feedback or failure as motivation to learn and to grow
You believe data-driven decision making is the norm
You relate to our core principles (link) and want to work with Conversational AI experts
Conversational Understanding and Automation

We are a team of software engineers who are passionate about technology, software development and machine learning. We are searching for smart and creative individuals who want to join us in our journey in delivering best automation for Liveperson services and conversations

Software Development Engineer (SDE) I

We are looking for smart, self-motivated software developers to join the Conversational Understanding and Automation team. Good testing expertise, deep knowledge about reactive systems and the ability to work with distributed systems is essential for this role.

About You
Your actions reveal that you are passionate and care about software development.
You have a flair for software design and like to talk about and discuss various software topics.
For you, software development is more than a job.
Fast Feedback

While developing we optimize for fast and data-driven feedback. We prototype and evaluate solution ideas. We capture behaviour in examples. From these scenarios we derive our tests and, preferably, drive them outside-in. We think this is a crucial mindset for a senior position. How do you get feedback from your code? If you have working experience with TDD, we want to know more. How much? Compared to us, how did you do it? What problems did you face? The more the better!

Analytical Skills

We depend on code in LivePerson which was built over a long time. We deliberately try to capture the current behavior before adapting it. However, this can be quite hard and requires a lot of skill. We consider this to be one trait of a senior position. If you worked with legacy code, we want to know more. How much? What was your approach? Did you work with it in a recent project? What problems have you faced? The more the better!

The Role

Our teams are autonomous, self-learning and provide support for the product. You will be part of our on-call and work with stakeholders in a collaborative manner. We recognize that things are not perfect here and we admit that we have challenges which need to be tackled. However, we are continuously improving and learning.

Technologies we use

Here Is a List Of Technologies We Currently Use

Most of our code is written in Scala and Java. We would be especially interested in candidates from this technological background but are open to other experiences as long as you have a very good understanding of object oriented programming, have experience in functional programming.
Scala, Java 11, Python
Spark, Kafka Streams, Cassandra, Seldon
Kubernetes, GCP
Junit 4, Testcontainers
Git, Github
Jenkins CI/CD
Why You’ll Love Working Here

LivePerson was named to FastCompany’s World’s most innovative companies of 2020 list for the Artificial Intelligence category. We offer top tier tech & data science colleagues, along with opportunities to push your own limits. We embrace invention and experimentation. You’ll have great benefits, flexible time off, plus snacks and drinks to keep your mind fresh and stomach full. Most importantly, you’ll have an ability to make an impact at work and at brands across the globe as we build the future with trusted Conversational AI together.

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to do their best work and be their authentic selves. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
title: Software Development Engineer

text:
To Succeed In Reaching Our Targets, We Are Seeking Committed Colleagues Who Can Stand Behind Our Core Values Of Inspiration, Simplicity And Integrity

Founded in Munich, Germany in 1989, Brainlab develops, manufactures and markets software-driven medical technology, enabling access to improved, more efficient, less-invasive patient treatments. Our key to success is our creative, talented and hard-working team, which consists of 1400 dedicated and inspiring individuals in 19 offices worldwide.

Software Engineer - Optimization Algorithms
Munich, Germany
Full-time
Department: R&D Software
What To Expect

Integrated in a team of physicists and computer scientists you will:
work on the further development of our product portfolio for treatment planning in radiotherapy
develop, evaluate and release new techniques that enable radiation planning to be automated
develop optimization algorithms and data analysis for radiation planning
What You Offer
you have completed a degree with a focus on medical physics, physics, computer science or a similar field
ideally, you already have practical experience in the field of radiotherapy, especially in data analysis, optimization and radiation planning
you enjoy programming and already have project experience in the programming language C++
very good communication skills in Englisch
you feel comfortable working in a dedicated team and in a dynamic environment.
What We Offer
working in a team of great colleagues who help and support each other
seeing your work making a positive impact on the daily work of clinicians around the world
30 days of vacation, plus 24.12. and 31.12.
flexible working hours
free gym courses with showers and changing rooms
secure bicycle storage room
excellent subsidized restaurant
regular after-work, team & company events
comprehensive training and continuing education opportunities
A position at Brainlab means that you’ll be part of a professional business environment working together with an excellent international team. You will be a valued member of a team of likeminded individuals. You’ll be assessed fairly and given great opportunities based on your performance.

Ready to apply? We look forward to receiving your online application including a motivation letter, your first available start date and desired salary.

Contact person: Géraldine Endres
title: Software Engineer - Optimization Algorithms

text:
Together, we can beat cancer.

At Varian, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions. If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you.

SW Development Engineer for the IDENTIFY product
Designs and develops secure software for our patient identification and monitoring solutions in C++
Analyzes security risks of our applications, defines technical requirements and designs validation and verification strategies.
Threat modeling and supports our team in implementing secure products
Ensures that software meets or exceeds software code quality guidelines
Works together in a distributed team with software and quality engineers
Job Requirements
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline
Working experience in software engineering required
Proficient command in object-oriented programming, C++
Experience with application or system hardening according to e.g. DISA STIGs
Hands on experience in security architecture
Enthusiasm and passion for IT-Security and high-quality software development
Good understanding of Agile and Scrum processes
Written and spoken fluency in English
Fighting cancer calls for big ideas.

We envision a world without fear of cancer. Achieving this vision takes dedication and commitment from all of us, every single day. That's why we celebrate and value the distinctly beautiful and intersectional identities of each of our employees. We are a mirror of our patient-base, which allows us to innovate. Big ideas come from everywhere, and the best ideas are fostered by our unique individual experiences. At Varian, we encourage you to bring your whole self to work and believe your bold and authentic perspective will help to power more victories over cancer.

#TogetherWeFight

title: Java Developer (m/f/d)

text:
About Care.com 
Care.com is a consumer tech company with heart. We’re on a mission to tackle a human challenge we all face: finding great care for the ones we love. We’re moms and dads and pet parents. We have parents and grandparents, so we understand that everyone, at some point in their lives, could use a helping hand. Our culture and our products reflect that.

Here, entrepreneurs, self-starters, teammates, and big thinkers unite behind a common cause. Here, we’re applying data analytics, AI and the latest technologies to solve universal problems and connect people in new ways. If you like having autonomy, if you thrive with collaboration and building new things, and if you’re all about using your talent for good, Care.com is the place for you. We are searching for Software Engineer l, II, Senior, Principal, and Architect Level Engineers!

What you believe in:
Doing what it takes to get the job done
Leading with trust and vulnerability
Leaving your ego at the door
Learning from others
Elevating your peers
Taking calculated risks

What you’re willing to do:
Work really hard
Invest in yourself
Take ownership of things
Commit to our vision
Jump in and take action
Fix sh*t if it’s broken
Test driven development
Monitoring and evaluation

What we’re about:
Giving families around the world a helping hand
Making a difference
Modernizing how everyone views “Care”

What we’re playing with:
Go
Java
GraphQL
React JS
Node
Micro Services
Kubernetes
Kafka
gRPC

**Care.com supports diverse families and communities and seeks employees who are just as diverse. As an equal opportunity employer, Care.com recognizes the power of a diverse and inclusive workforce and encourages applications from individuals with varied experiences, perspectives, and backgrounds. Care.com is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to career.de@care.com**
____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Company Overview:
Available in more than 20 countries, Care.com is the world's leading platform for finding and managing high-quality family care. Care.com is designed to meet the evolving needs of today's families and caregivers, offering everything from household tax and payroll services and customized corporate benefits packages covering the care needs of working families, to innovating new ways for caregivers to be paid and obtain professional benefits. Since 2007, families have relied on Care.com's industry-leading products—from child and elder care to pet care and home care. Care.com is an IAC company (NASDAQ: IAC).

title: Software Engineer (m/f/d) Applications

text:
At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.

Software Engineer (m/f/d)

We in Bayer’s product platform research are seeking excellent full stack developers (m/f/d) driven by our mission “Health for all, hunger for none”. In our DevOps teams you can follow (y)our purpose and grow while working on tough challenges in a global pharma research setting. If you are passionate about creating cutting edge software together with scientists to help cure life-threatening diseases, we would love to hear from you. Your tasks in detail:

Your Tasks And Responsibilities
You design, develop, and continuously deliver cutting edge software products in a fast-moving environment of the Pharma business
You perform hands-on full-stack software development based on cloud infrastructure
You take decisions to advance product development or team culture in a timely manner
You help identifying the most important problems to solve, minimize scope and assess the value of solutions
You apply your expertise in natural sciences in mixed teams consisting of IT and R&D experts (biologists/chemists/pharmacologists)
You develop and execute on a technical vision for evolvable systems
You identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and develop solutions to meet team and product goals
You help growing other engineers by leveraging technical knowledge and leadership skills as well as promote the principles behind DevOps and utilize DevOps practices to build and deploy high-quality software effectively and efficiently
You help scale DevOps capabilities in the organization
Who You Are
University degree in computer science or equivalent natural science degree e.g. computational biology/chemistry
You have several years of professional experience in and expert-level knowledge of two or more modern programming languages and frameworks
You have proven and profound experience in principles behind agile, lean and continuous delivery approaches as well as hands-on experience with test-driven development (TDD) and infrastructure automation
You have a sound knowledge of cloud technology such as AWS or Docker
You have solid leadership skills and displayed entrepreneurial behavior in your daily work
You are resilient, able to deal with ambiguous situations and approach challenges from multiple perspectives
Fluent in English, both written and spoken, German is a plus
YOUR APPLICATION

This is your opportunity to tackle the world’s biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.

Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

Location: Berlin, Wuppertal-Aprath

Division: Enabling Functions

Reference Code: 474257
title: Software Engineer (m/f/d)
